> Ah, ok; I understand what you were saying now - I was talking about 
total map generation!

That's the next logical step after being able to place objects 
randomly on a map.  Total map generation would be even cooler.

Though, admittedly, I am concerned about random placement of the 
objects in the weapons family because the only ones that really do 
anything are blood and doors, unless somebody shows up explaining how 
to make the rest of those objects in the weapons family active when 
you place them in a scenario with a scenario editor. I have tried 
adjusting commands on the rest of the objects in the weapons family 
with the scenario converter's help just to see if I build a scenario 
with a bomb ready to go off.
